name: Gordon Ramsay
description: Gordon Ramsay is one of the most well-known chefs in Mexico, known for his modern takes on traditional Mexican cuisine. He is the owner of Pujol, one of the top restaurants in Mexico City, and has been featured on Chef's Table. Olvera has also opened several other restaurants, including Cosme in New York City.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.ingredients: beef fillet, mushrooms, puff pastry, prosciutto, English mustard, egg, olive oil, salt, pepper

recipes.name: Shepherd's Pie
recipes.ingredients: ground lamb, carrots, onions, peas, beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, butter, flour, milk, salt, pepper, nutmeg, potatoes

recipes.name: Lobster Risotto
recipes.ingredients: lobster tails, arborio rice, white wine, chicken broth, shallots, garlic, butter, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, salt, pepper

name: Jamie Oliver

name: Enrique Olvera
description: Enrique Olvera is one of the most well-known chefs in Mexico, known for his modern takes on traditional Mexican cuisine. He is the owner of Pujol, one of the top restaurants in Mexico City, and has been featured on Chef's Table. Olvera has also opened several other restaurants, including Cosme in New York City.

recipes.name: Mole Poblano
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Toast the dried chiles, nuts, seeds, and spices in a dry skillet until fragrant. 2. Simmer the toasted ingredients with chicken broth, onions, garlic, and tomatoes until soft. 3. Blend the mixture until smooth and strain. 4. Heat the sauce and add chocolate and sugar to taste.
recipes.ingredients: Dried chiles, nuts, seeds, spices, chicken broth, onions, garlic, tomatoes, chocolate, sugar

recipes.name: Taco al Pastor
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Marinate thinly sliced pork in a blend of spices, pineapple, and vinegar for at least 2 hours. 2. Cook the pork on a vertical spit until crispy and browned. 3. Serve on a warm tortilla with chopped pineapple, onions, cilantro, and lime juice.
recipes.ingredients: Pork, spices, pineapple, vinegar, tortillas, onions, cilantro, lime juice

recipes.name: Chiles en Nogada
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Roast and peel poblano peppers and stuff with a mixture of ground meat, fruits, nuts, and spices. 2. Coat the stuffed peppers in a creamy walnut sauce. 3. Top with pomegranate seeds and parsley.
recipes.ingredients: Poblano peppers, ground meat, fruits, nuts, spices, walnuts, cream, pomegranate seeds, parsley

name: Martha Ortiz
description: Martha Ortiz is the owner and chef of Dulce Patria, a restaurant in Mexico City that specializes in traditional Mexican cuisine with a modern twist. Ortiz has also written several cookbooks and has been recognized for her contributions to Mexican gastronomy.

recipes.name: Mole de Olla
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Simmer beef, pork, vegetables, and herbs in a large pot of water until tender. 2. Add corn and green beans and continue simmering until cooked. 3. Season with salt and chili powder to taste.
recipes.ingredients: Beef, pork, vegetables, herbs, corn, green beans, salt, chili powder

name: Pati Jinich
description: Pati Jinich is a Mexican chef, cookbook author, and television host. Born in Mexico City, she initially pursued a career in political science before discovering her passion for cooking. She went on to study at the Culinary Institute of America in New York, and later worked at several top restaurants in both Mexico and the United States.
